image.alt: Smiling patient at DeFelice Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: DeFelice Orthodontics is a progressive and friendly orthodontic practice in Cape May Court House, Hammonton and West Creek, NJ, where Dr. Gregory J. DeFelice and our staff are committed to providing comprehensive orthodontic care for children, adolescents, and adults. We offer a wide range of treatment options, completely customized to suit your orthodontic needs and lifestyle. Our highly skilled team and our innovative treatments and technologies will give you the confidence that you are receiving the highest standard of orthodontic care available. At the orthodontic office of Dr. DeFelice, your smile is our top priority — we look forward to helping your family with their orthodontic needs.

image.alt: Friendly patient-focused team

items.text: We prioritize relationships, clear communication and up-to-date technology so your experience is comfortable and predictable.

paragraphs.text: Gregory J. DeFelice, DMD, MS, is a board-certified orthodontist and Diplomate of the American Board of Orthodontics. He completed his DMD at Temple University and earned his master’s degree and orthodontic specialty training at the University of Illinois at Chicago. Dr. DeFelice lectures and remains active in the professional community, bringing advanced training and a steady focus on patient comfort to every case.

image.alt: Dr. Gregory DeFelice, board-certified orthodontist

paragraphs.text: We provide modern treatment options for children, teens and adults, from removable clear aligners to efficient braces systems and early interceptive appliances.

I would recommend DeFelice Orthodontics to anyone looking to enhance their dental appearance.”

og_meta.title: Home - DeFelice Orthodontics
og_meta.description: DeFelice Orthodontics provides advanced, comfortable orthodontic care in Cape May Court House, Hammonton, and West Creek, NJ.

image.alt: Smiling patients and team in a bright orthodontic office representing what sets us apart

paragraphs.text: At DeFelice Orthodontics, we appreciate the trust you have placed in us, and we are honored that you have chosen our practice for your orthodontic needs. It is our desire to provide a unique professional experience for all who encounter our office.

We strive for excellence in all areas of our profession and seek to treat every patient as we would want to be treated. Our primary concern is about relationships: we want to be there with you, every step of the way, and give you a great smile that will last a lifetime.
Our practice offers customized treatment options to fit each patient’s lifestyle, including modern braces and clear aligner choices, delivered with compassionate, patient-focused care.
By combining proven clinical techniques, state-of-the-art technology, and a friendly team, we make orthodontic care comfortable and achievable for families across our communities.

image.alt: Dr. Gregory J. DeFelice smiling headshot

paragraphs.text: Dr. Gregory DeFelice grew up in the Philadelphia suburbs. He earned his Bachelor’s degree, graduating Magna Cum Laude with general university honors from LaSalle University. Dr. DeFelice then completed his Doctorate of Dental Medicine at Temple University School of Dentistry, graduating second in his class, and received his Master’s degree in Orthodontics from the University of Illinois at Chicago.

Dr. DeFelice is a board-certified Diplomate of the American Board of Orthodontics and an active member of the American Association of Orthodontists and the Middle Atlantic Society of Orthodontists. He also lectures to orthodontic residents at the University of Illinois at Chicago.

image.alt: Dr. Gregory J. DeFelice professional portrait

paragraphs.text: Education and training include: Bachelor’s degree, LaSalle University (Magna Cum Laude); Doctorate of Dental Medicine, Temple University School of Dentistry; Master’s degree in Orthodontics, University of Illinois at Chicago. Board-certified Diplomate, American Board of Orthodontics. Member, American Association of Orthodontists and Middle Atlantic Society of Orthodontists.

image.alt: Dr. DeFelice in clinical setting

paragraphs.text: Outside the office, Dr. DeFelice supports the community through local sports sponsorships and fundraisers. He enjoys fishing, traveling, cooking, and spending time with animals and family.

image.alt: Dr. DeFelice smiling and engaging with community

paragraphs.text: Dr. DeFelice gives back to the community by sponsoring local sports teams and supporting fundraisers. Our practice values community connection and regularly participates in events that promote health and a positive experience for local families.

image.alt: Patient forms and new patient paperwork at DeFelice Orthodontics

paragraphs.text: Your first visit is a comprehensive new patient exam. You will meet our team, receive a complete oral exam and any necessary X-rays, and we will discuss treatment options tailored to your needs.
We will review your medical history, answer questions about timing and treatment choices for children, teens, and adults, and go over financial options so you know what to expect before care begins.

image.alt: Father with daughter at reception of dentist's surgery

paragraphs.text: We accept most major insurance plans and file claims electronically to make billing easy. Our team will verify benefits and explain how your coverage applies to orthodontic treatment.

Flexible payment plans and third-party financing options are available. Our treatment coordinator will help you choose a plan that fits your budget and point you to the patient portal at https://patient.sesamecommunications.com/dvbraces/index.html for account access.
Before your appointment, please complete your new patient paperwork. Printable forms and online submissions are available so we can review your information before your visit.

Use our online resources to save time on the day of your appointment. If you prefer printable forms, download and bring them with you. To request an appointment or access your account, use the links below.

image.alt: Patient filling out new patient forms online
Enjoying time together

image.alt: Smiling patients of all ages in a bright orthodontic office

paragraphs.text: Spark Clear Aligners are a clear, removable alternative to traditional braces. Each tray is custom-made and designed to move teeth gradually; patients typically wear aligners about 22 hours a day for each one- to two-week stage.

image.alt: Spark clear aligner product image

paragraphs.text: The Damon system uses a passive, self-ligating bracket that holds the archwire in place without elastic ties, often allowing teeth to move more freely with fewer adjustments.
Damon Ultima, used alongside advanced treatment approaches, can help reduce overall treatment time for many patients when clinically appropriate.

image.alt: Damon Smile orthodontic brackets

paragraphs.text: Traditional metal braces remain a durable, cost-effective option that uses brackets and wires to move teeth into position over time.
Clear braces offer a more discreet fixed option by blending with tooth color while still providing reliable tooth movement for many cases.

image.alt: Two smiling teens with braces taking a selfie

paragraphs.text: Phase One, or interceptive treatment, evaluates jaw growth and tooth eruption early to guide development. Treating certain issues around age seven can reduce complexity later and sometimes avoid extractions.
Examples include expanders and partial braces that create space and improve function, often shortening or simplifying later treatment.

image.alt: Phase One orthodontic treatment before image

paragraphs.text: The Herbst appliance is a fixed device that helps encourage forward growth of the lower jaw to correct certain overbite problems. It offers a discreet, compliance-free alternative to headgear for appropriate cases.
Muscle tenderness and soreness are common at first but usually ease as the mouth adapts.
Metal parts can irritate soft tissues during the adjustment period; dental wax helps reduce rubbing.
Stick to softer foods initially and avoid sticky or hard items that can damage the appliance.

image.alt: Orthodontic patient receiving orthognathic surgical consultation

paragraphs.text: A palatal expander gently widens the upper jaw to create space and correct crossbites or crowding. It’s commonly used in growing children and remains in place for months to stabilize the expansion.

image.alt: Model of a palatal expander appliance

paragraphs.text: Retainers protect your new alignment. We offer both removable and fixed options and provide clear care instructions so results last long term.
Care tips include brushing retainers regularly, soaking when recommended, and avoiding heat that can warp the appliance.

image.alt: Patient holding a clear orthodontic retainer

paragraphs.text: Laser dentistry can make certain procedures more precise and comfortable, often reducing recovery time. Uses include soft‑tissue contouring, treatment of benign lesions, and adjunctive therapies when clinically appropriate.

image.alt: Modern dental office interior with advanced equipment
Enjoying time together

image.alt: Patient smiling with orthodontic braces in our Emeryville office

paragraphs.text: Find answers to common questions about braces, oral hygiene, dental checkups, activities, and appointments at DV Braces.
Braces do not often hurt though you may feel a small amount of discomfort for a couple days as your teeth, gums, cheeks, and mouth get used to your new braces.

image.alt: Happy Family Portrait

accordion.header: Do I need to brush my teeth more often if I have braces?

paragraphs.text: With braces, you should brush your teeth at least three times a day to keep your teeth, gums, and mouth healthy and clean. Brushing regularly will help remove any food that may be caught between the braces. You should also floss daily to get in between your braces where your brush isn't able to reach. Your orthodontist can show you how to properly brush and floss once your braces are placed.

image.alt: Couple Enjoying Time Together

accordion.header: If I have braces, do I still need dental checkups every six months?

paragraphs.text: Yes! In fact, it's even more important that patients receiving orthodontic treatment visit their dentist regularly. With braces, food may be caught in places that your toothbrush can't reach. This causes bacteria to build up that can lead to cavities, gingivitis, and gum disease. Your dentist will work closely with your orthodontist to make sure that your teeth stay clean and healthy while wearing braces.

image.alt: Collaborative Team Spirit Moment

accordion.header: Will my braces interfere with my school activities like sports, playing an instrument, or singing?

paragraphs.text: Playing an instrument or a contact sport may require some adjustment when you first get your braces, but wearing braces will not stop you from participating in any of your school activities. If you play a contact sport, it is recommended that you wear a mouthguard to protect your braces or appliance.

image.alt: Smiling Man Working at Desk

accordion.header: How do I schedule my next appointment?

paragraphs.text: Simply call our practice! Our front desk staff will be happy to help schedule your next appointment at your convenience. If you are a new patient or have been referred to our practice, please let us know and we will provide you with all of the information you need.

image.alt: Mother and Daughter Smiling Together
Enjoying time together
